p: Pregnancy and reproductive health is a key motivator for women who use drugs to engage in harm reduction services that are relevant to their needs. Where these services are absent from harm reduction, it can form another barrier to access for women. Where services have been integrated, evidence shows that uptake of both reproductive health and harm reduction services is increased. By either sharing a site or having robust referral pathways, reproductive health and harm reduction services can be mutually reinforcing in reducing barriers to access [ 8].
